intro: Erythroxylum sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran erythroxylum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Erythroxylaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It is not closely related to the coca plant, despite sharing the same genus.
